com.github.dandelion.core.web

Class AssetRequestContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dandelion.core.web.AssetRequestContext

  • public class AssetRequestContext
extends Object

    Main user-side entry point for manipulating the Dandelion context associated to the current HttpServletRequest.

    The context can be manipulated in many ways:

    • By adding/removing bundle(s) (using the bundle names) 
       AssetRequestContext.get(request).addBundle("myBundle");
 AssetRequestContext.get(request).addBundles("myBundle1", "myBundle2");
    • By excluding asset(s) (using the asset names) 
       AssetRequestContext.get(request).addBundle("myBundle1").excludeAsset("assetName1");
    • By configuring an AssetContentGenerator 
       AssetRequestContext.get(request).addBundle("myBundle1").addGenerator("uid", generator);
    Since:
    0.10.0
    Author:
    Romain Lespinasse, Thibault Duchateau

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static AssetRequestContext get(javax.servlet.ServletRequest servletRequest)

        Returns the AssetRequestContext associated to the passed ServletRequest.

        If it doesn't exist, a new instance is created and stored as a request attribute.

        Parameters:
        servletRequest - The servlet request in which is stored the AssetRequestContext.
        Returns:
        the instance of AssetRequestContext associated with the current servlet request.

      • addBundles

        public AssetRequestContext addBundles(String bundles)

        Adds the given comma-separated list of bundles to the current AssetRequestContext.

        Parameters:
        bundles - A comma-separated list of bundles.
        Returns:
        the current AssetRequestContext updated with the active bundle.

      • addBundles

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the current AssetRequestContext.

      • addBundles

        public AssetRequestContext addBundles(Enum<?>... bundles)

        Adds the given array of enum to the current AssetRequestContext.*

        All enums are first processed by replacing "_" by "-" and by lowercasing its value.

        Parameters:
        bundles - An array containing the enums.
        Returns:
        the current AssetRequestContext.

        Returns:
        the current AssetRequestContext#

      • addBundle

        public AssetRequestContext addBundle(Enum<?> bundle)

        Adds the given enum (representing a bundle name) to the current AssetRequestContext.

        The passed enum is first processed by replacing "_" by "-" and by lowercasing its value.

        Parameters:
        bundle - The enum to add.
        Returns:
        the current AssetRequestContext.

      • getBundles

        public String[] getBundles(boolean withoutExcludedBundles)
        Returns:
        all bundle names stored in the current AssetRequestContext

      • excludeBundles

        public AssetRequestContext excludeBundles(String bundles)

        Excludes a comma-separated list of bundle names from the current AssetRequestContext.

        Parameters:
        bundles - A comma-separated list of bundle names to exclude.
        Returns:
        the current AssetRequestContext.
